metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9472 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The email gateway in RT (aka Request Tracker) 3.0.0 through 4.x before 4.0.23 and 4.2.x before 4.2.10 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU and disk consumption) via a crafted email.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

request-tracker4 - 4.2.8-3
rt4-apache2 - 4.2.8-3
rt4-clients - 4.2.8-3
rt4-db-mysql - 4.2.8-3
rt4-db-postgresql - 4.2.8-3
rt4-db-sqlite - 4.2.8-3
rt4-fcgi - 4.2.8-3
rt4-standalone - 4.2.8-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: request-tracker4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.8-3').
